awd_titl_txt: Investigations of the Marine Organic Carbon Cycle in the    North Atlantic Ocean
awd_abstract_narration: Radiocarbon and stable carbon isotope ratios and various                other chemical properties in the major organic and inorganic                    carbon pools will be investigated in the North Atlantic Ocean.                  Measurements will be made of dissolved organic and inorganic                    carbon (DOC and DIC) in a detailed profile (18 depths) collected                at a site near Station S off Bermuda in the Sargasso Sea.  In                   addition, radiocarbon and stable isotope ratios in specific                     organic compounds of the DOC (humic and labile constituents) will               be measured.  Suspended particulate organic carbon (POC) will be                collected from 10 depths and sinking POC from 3 depths (1000,                   2600 and 3600 m) at the same site.  The goals of this project are               to formulate the pathways that carbon follows in the open ocean                 water column of the North Atlantic, and to compare these results                with those obtained earlier for the North Pacific.  In                          particular, there is interest in determining the sources and time               constants involved in the cycling of DOC, especially those which                involve the sediment and POC in the water column.  The goals of                 this project are directly related to those of the Global Ocean                  Flux Study (GOFS).

inst.inst_name: University of California-San Diego Scripps Inst of Oceanography
